title: Coordination of Impact of Higher Education Institutions on Regional Economies Initiative
abstractText:
The higher education in regional economies initiative will be jointly coordinated by Ms Ursula Kelly and Professor Peter McGregor of the University of Strathclyde. Active coordination is intended to provide an enabling framework for the sharing and exchange of knowledge and interim research findings among award holders so that a mutually supportive research community of award-holders can be created and sustained.

The coordinators will maintain regular contact with both  the research groups and  with the core interested stakeholders to ensure ongoing relevance, and identification of potential relevance, of the research outputs to the higher education policies of both devolved and central government administrations.

Coordination activities will include a user-friendly and accessible website where information about the initiative and up to date diary of events can be found. There will be programme of events focussing on different aspects of the research being undertaken and its relevance to higher education policy developments. An initiative-specific series of working papers and discussion papers will be established to enable early and speedy communication of interim and final research findings. A high level plain English research brief series will also be initiated and managed.
